openIGTInterface
Class LWRVisualizationInterface

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      openIGTInterface.LWRVisualizationInterface
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class LWRVisualizationInterface
extends java.lang.Thread

This Class for the Communication with a Visualization system using the opnIGTLink protocol is based on the igtlink4j class developed at the WPI.

Author:
Sebastian Tauscher
See Also:
SimpleStateExample

                   throws java.io.IOException
Starts the listening server on the defined port.

Parameters:

Throws:
java.io.IOException

SetDHTransformation

public void SetDHTransformation(com.kuka.roboticsAPI.deviceModel.JointPosition q)
In this function the Matrixtransformation for each Joint is calculated from the set of denavit hardenberg parameter

run

public void run()
Main function of the Visualization Interface. In this function the server is initialized and a packet handler is started. In a loop with a cycle time of 20 ms the new Command String is received and the Acknowledgment String send.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread
Parameters:
IP - the IP address of the State Control Computer, e.g. the system where your Slicer/Matlab GUI is running.
port - the port number used for the communication with the State Control Computer.
See Also:

pushTransformMessage

public void pushTransformMessage(java.lang.String deviceName,
                                 com.neuronrobotics.sdk.addons.kinematics.math.TransformNR t)
In this function the tranform message is packed and send to the openIGTClient by calling the sendMessage function.

Parameters:
deviceName - - Device Name of the open IGTLink Transform message send to the visualization software
t - - the transformation to be send
